alert.note: Alert for Cleveland; Garvin; Grady; Hughes; McClain; Pontotoc; Pottawatomie; Seminole (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 04 at 4:42PM CDT until April 04 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central Oklahoma, east central Oklahoma, southeast Oklahoma and southern Oklahoma, including the following counties, in central Oklahoma, Cleveland, Grady, McClain and Pottawatomie. In east central Oklahoma, Pontotoc and Seminole. In southeast Oklahoma, Hughes. In southern Oklahoma, Garvin. * WHEN...Until 745 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 442 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southeastern Norman, Ada, Chickasha, Blanchard, Seminole, Pauls Valley, Purcell, Holdenville, Noble, Slaughterville, Wewoka, Lindsay, Lexington, Goldsby, Stratford, Konawa, Wetumka, Maysville, Rush Springs and Byng. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Cleveland; Garvin; Grady; Hughes; McClain; Pontotoc; Pottawatomie; Seminole
